workout_file.author: Zwift
workout_file.name: Week 1.4 - Sweet Spot Ramps - 30min
workout_file.description: A sweet spot focused workout where you'll accumulate 30min in total at that intensity.

textevent.message: Welcome to a sweet spot focused workout today!
We're going to start off with an 8min warmup at a comfortable cadence.
And we'll catch up soon once you're settled in.
Do you have your fluids, fan, and towel all set?
All right, let's rundown the plan for today.
We'll be tackling 3, 10min sweet spot (SST) ramp intervals today.
With a 5min recovery in between each.
SST work is a favorite of mine since it provides great training stimulus.
But, doesn't require a ton of time to achieve, and can be repeated frequently.
SST is also a common intensity you'll be working at in Zwift races on the flats.
So, even more appropriate to include in this plan :-)
Let's carry on with the warmup today.
Final minute of the warmup, then we'll take a couple of minutes easy.
Great work! Now, let's bring it down really easy for a couple of minutes at a comfortable cadence.
Take few deep breaths and recover.
The main set is just around the bend, remember we're aiming for 3, 10min ramp intervals at SST.
The ramp will start at 85% FTP, and finish at 95% FTP.
With a target cadence of 90-100 RPM.
Ready? Bring your cadence up just a bit now.
Let's get into it today! Use this 1st minute to just ease into things and find your rhythm.
If you don't have a cadence sensor, just spin at a comfortable cadence.
Okay awesome work! Now, settle down and tap out the rhythm.
How are you doing so far? You should feel like you're more than able to match this interval.
That's halfway! Remember to be taking frequent sips of fluid during these workouts and wipe that sweat away.
You should see a steady increase in your heart rate over these intervals as well.
And ideally equal spacing between power and heart rate if you have the graph at the bottom of your screen.
This is also called power to heart rate 'coupling'.
Final minute!
Push yourself all the way to the arch!
Beautiful work! Now, let's take the effort down and recover here. We have 2 more of those to do.
Breathe...We'll catch up with 1min to go.
1min to go. We're going to be repeating that same interval again next.
Ready? Bring your cadence up a bit again now.
Okay, here we go with the 2nd SST interval!
It's normal and okay for this one to feel more challenging compared to the 1st.
This is because your legs have some work in them and the muscles are a little fatigued.
1min into things again. Settle down now and tap out that familiar rhythm.
So far so good? You can always change the FTP bias if things are feeling too easy/hard.
Use your arrow keys, or the Zwift Companion app.
That's halfway! Remember to be taking frequent sips of fluid during these workouts and wipe that sweat away.
Just 2min remain for the 2nd interval today, you're looking GREAT!
C'mon! Dig now. You're almost done with this!
Push yourself all the way to the arch!!
Done! Let's recover again here and get ready for the finale.
We'll catch up again with 1min to go.
Ready for the finale? I want the same effort and cadence again next.
Bring your cadence up a bit again now.
Let's make it happen here! Make this finale just as good as the 1st interval.
You should ideally a similar heart rate trend for this 3rd interval.
However, it's okay if you notice a 'decoupling' where the heart rate rises faster.
This is due to dehydration, overheating, and/or fatigue.
Most of the time, it's due to fatigue and your body using a greater number of motor units.
The greater the number of motor units being used, the greater the energy demand, and higher heart rate.
Halfway through this finale! You're looking awesome, my friend!
Take a drink here and let's finish up these final 3mins!
Last minute! DIG here!
PUSH TO THE ARCH!
Way to go! Solid 30mins of SST work done by you today!
Let's take 5min and cooldown here.
Then hop off the bike and start rehydrating and refueling for the next one.
See you next time :-)
